title: Games feel like they end faster now
body:
The first 14 minutes of a game with those outer turret barriers- game feels good. Good pacing, no “FF@15”. When those barriers drop, everything seems to snowball to a rapid conclusion.

While I understand todays league audience may want quicker games, and I respect that, its kind of heart breaking to me I have to go back to DotA 2 if I want 35-45 minute games.

This is just an observation, not criticism, entirely my opinion.

That really depends on the game.
On one hand I love those 34-34 games where it's neck and neck and results in one good play to change it all? Yes.
However... Those 43-10 games where people refuse to surrender and turtle? I could do without that.

No offense but how often does the last part happen now(pre this patch)? I would rather risk having that kind of game compared to the games now or where they may be trying to get the future of league to go too.

Had one of those just the other day; 45+ minutes, inting Sion tactic, all inhibitors and two barons lost.

We still won. Crazy stuff.

But both scenarios are tied together.
To have a 43-10 game end faster, there are multiple potent snowball mechanics in the game (most of the came in season 6 to 8).

But these snowball mechanics are also at fault, that a 43-10 happens so frequently in matches where roughly equally skilled players play against each other.

You dont even need to be more skilled than your opponent to get 10-0 out of laning phase, just one good early gank with the jungler and you pushing up to tower, getting tons of local gold... Because of the item advantage you can deny the enemy cs, get your first item 2 minutes earlier, and you are at the point where you dont even need to hit skillshots anymore too oneshote him, if he plays safe, make sure your team gets rift herald and you steamroll the game to it's end.

Yes and one thing Riot seems to forget is that the biggest aspect of comebacks is not having the average game time be so low.

That’s not necessarily true. You can make a “comeback” at 15 minutes from being behind at 10 in the same way that you can make a comeback at 40 minutes  after being behind at 25. There’s nothing that makes one comeback more special than the other, other than one comeback taking much more time than the other.

The longer the game, the more opportunities you tend to have to outplay and generate or exploit mistakes. Comebacks can happen at any point but let's say you have a minute to make your comeback or 10. Even if the game offers more comeback mechanics, players will be making more decisions in 10 minutes of play and thus will have more chances to play better and slowly get back into it.

Cause you will pretty much never be able to shut him down and the chances of the getting getting to the late game team fights you were built for is way lower. Also the gold on kill can suck. I feel like people who are getting stomped get rewarded now.  I have been on both sides.  Stomp and get punished via bounty system.  Get stomped and last hit a champ for a crap ton of gold.  Not sure I like it either way.

I think that the games are roughly the same length, but last season late game basically didn't exist and this year midgame is being pushed out by the new changes. Basically as soon as the towers fall out becomes a 3-5 minute fiesta then someone wins.
Right so how is that the same length prior? Prior to this patch I didn't have consistent games where 15 minutes hits and we are for sure losing and done, now that's like every fucking game lol.

It's because riot gives them the FEELING they have a chance to comeback due to bounties and shit and because there isn't much push until 14 mins it feels like games aren'T decided AS quick as before but they are because someone got 1400 gold from just one turret and will smash the game once plating falls off.

If you're playing normals, this is to be expected as teams who are obviously going to win, will now win faster and norms have huge skill gaps in them. If you're playing ranked, eventually during the actual ranked season I predict the new close out the game faster thing will make ranked more even. All the players who shouldn't be where they are will lose faster, all the ones who deserve to be higher will win faster, and all the middle people will suffer while the other two groups are at war. But eventually it'll even out and the only time you'll have trouble is when you get smurfs in your games or boosted people. Both are pretty rare so it'll be whatever.
Tbh I feel like this is because of the new champion bounties. It feels like a ridiculous amount of gold is being tossed around. More gold = faster scaling = shorter games.

Yup. 
Game time is pretty much the same but you have more items. 
People currently don't give a shit and int left and right so there is a lot of gold thrown around and people reach their items faster make it seem like games take longer. 
But all in all it's actually shorter due to all the gold.
For me the games feel alot closer
Yeah, once the plates drop, turrets feel squisher than before and the game even more snowbally.

I've had 30 - 40 minute + games. I'm not sure why people act like games are ending quicker. Towers actually hurt now, they're super tanky, don't reset aggro dmg, etc. I don't understand what the boards complaints are. This is everything you guys have asked for. Games swing back with high shut down gold, and when they are stomps they end decisively.

Ive to aggree. Games seems to end faster . However, this sensation may come from the brutal transition after 14 min. It feels like going straight in late game.

I agree on your observation. i think this has 2 major reasons.
1. the tower plats give to much money. so winning lanes dont take tower, but create a big item advantage.
2. the towers after 14 min are softer then paper. and with the item adventage on early game champs they drop even faster.
i think the game snowballs faster and ealier then before, you just see the results later then before.

but maybe LS is right and it is just a question of time until players adept and games go longer. i really hope he is right on this 1, because 20 min games are too short imo.

I mean the alternative was taking tower at like 9 minutes in stomps, taking dragon, taking mid tower, and then taking top tower and completely starving everyone out of the game. Rotations happen later now which keeps people generally confined in their lanes for their lead so it is much less likely that the 3/0 bot lane will show up mid until after 14 minutes.
yeah, i still think turret plating was a step into the right direction, but they really need some fine tuning. the plates should give less gold and inner turrets should be tankier then outer.

I honestly just want the minion movement speed change reverted. Makes it too hard to catch all the "slow" pushes when behind since no wave is a slow push. Side lanes are constantly rubberbanding now with no one in them. They did rubberband before, but now it is in cycles of every like 1 minute as opposed to 2-3.
I don't think it makes quicker games, it just makes come backs easier and sealing the deal easier as well.

In contradiction to this,shutdown gold is really unfair now,because even if you die with 1k gold on you, you will still worth 700 once you respawn.It makes comebacks achievable so much easier and you litteraly get punished for littlest mistakes when playing extremely well?

According to data, outer towers aren't falling as fast as they used to on average by about a minute or two, but the rest of the game is paced about the same. Average game length hasn't changed at all.

One reason is because everyone who play with Resolve runes take Demolish now since it's the only rune left that doesn't suck or is hardcore niche.

Also people (Jungler) have more motivation to attack towers now.
I can speak for myself as Jungler:
Even if i always knew that killing towers fast is the only/best way to win, i often leave it to the laners.
Now i see the 5 Plates and i am greedy as fuck for the gold after a successful gank.
Before the patch it gave me no benefit in the short term.
The only thing i thought when i helped damaging tower was: "aww man, i lose time/gold in the jungle".
Now i get rewarded instantly.

Also: Instead of roaming after a lane kill people greed for the tower now.

I don't say it's bad.
